trans-unit.source: Getting started with the Azure AD Reporting API
trans-unit.target: Getting started with the Azure AD Reporting API

trans-unit.source: How to get started with the Azure Active Directory Reporting API
trans-unit.target: How to get started with the Azure Active Directory Reporting API

trans-unit.source: Getting started with the Azure AD Reporting API
trans-unit.target: Getting started with the Azure AD Reporting API

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory provides a variety of activity, security and audit reports.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory provides a variety of activity, security and audit reports.

trans-unit.source: This data can be consumed through the Azure portal, but can also be very useful in a many other applications, such as SIEM systems, audit, and business intelligence tools.
trans-unit.target: This data can be consumed through the Azure portal, but can also be very useful in a many other applications, such as SIEM systems, audit, and business intelligence tools.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD Reporting APIs provide programmatic access to these data through a set of REST-based APIs that can be called from a variety programming languages and tools.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD Reporting APIs provide programmatic access to these data through a set of REST-based APIs that can be called from a variety programming languages and tools.

trans-unit.source: This article will walk you through the process of calling the Azure AD Reporting APIs using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This article will walk you through the process of calling the Azure AD Reporting APIs using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: You can modify the sample PowerShell script to access data from any of the available reports in JSON, XML or text format, as your scenario requires.
trans-unit.target: You can modify the sample PowerShell script to access data from any of the available reports in JSON, XML or text format, as your scenario requires.

trans-unit.source: To use this sample, you will need an <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: To use this sample, you will need an <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Creating an Azure AD application to access the API
trans-unit.target: Creating an Azure AD application to access the API

trans-unit.source: The Reporting API uses <link><linkText>OAuth</linkText><title></title></link> to authorize access to the web APIs.
trans-unit.target: The Reporting API uses <link><linkText>OAuth</linkText><title></title></link> to authorize access to the web APIs.

trans-unit.source: To access information from your directory, you must create an application in your Active Directory, and grant it appropriate permissions to access the AAD data.
trans-unit.target: To access information from your directory, you must create an application in your Active Directory, and grant it appropriate permissions to access the AAD data.

trans-unit.source: Create an application
trans-unit.target: Create an application

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Navigate into your directory.
trans-unit.target: Navigate into your directory.

trans-unit.source: Navigate into applications.
trans-unit.target: Navigate into applications.

trans-unit.source: On the bottom bar, click "Add".
trans-unit.target: On the bottom bar, click "Add".

trans-unit.source: Click "Add an application my organization is developing".
trans-unit.target: Click "Add an application my organization is developing".

trans-unit.source: Name: Any name is fine.
trans-unit.target: Name: Any name is fine.

trans-unit.source: Something like "Reporting API Application" is recommended.
trans-unit.target: Something like "Reporting API Application" is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Type: Select "Web application and/or Web API".
trans-unit.target: Type: Select "Web application and/or Web API".

trans-unit.source: Click the arrow to move to the next page.
trans-unit.target: Click the arrow to move to the next page.

trans-unit.source: Sign-on URL: http://localhost.
trans-unit.target: Sign-on URL: http://localhost.

trans-unit.source: App ID URI: http://localhost.
trans-unit.target: App ID URI: http://localhost.

trans-unit.source: Click the checkmark to finish adding the application.
trans-unit.target: Click the checkmark to finish adding the application.

trans-unit.source: Grant your application permission to use the API
trans-unit.target: Grant your application permission to use the API

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Applications tab.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Applications tab.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your newly created application.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your newly created application.

trans-unit.source: Click the Configure tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Configure tab.

trans-unit.source: In the "Permissions to Other Applications" section:
trans-unit.target: In the "Permissions to Other Applications" section:

trans-unit.source: In the microsoft Azure Active Directory > Application Permissions, select Read directory data.
trans-unit.target: In the microsoft Azure Active Directory > Application Permissions, select Read directory data.

trans-unit.source: Click Save on the bottom bar.
trans-unit.target: Click Save on the bottom bar.

trans-unit.source: Get your directory ID, client ID, and client secret
trans-unit.target: Get your directory ID, client ID, and client secret

trans-unit.source: The steps below will walk you through obtaining your application's client ID and client secret.
trans-unit.target: The steps below will walk you through obtaining your application's client ID and client secret.

trans-unit.source: You will also need to know your tenant name, it can be either your *.onmicrosoft.com or a custom domain name.
trans-unit.target: You will also need to know your tenant name, it can be either your *.onmicrosoft.com or a custom domain name.

trans-unit.source: Copy these into a separate place; you'll use them to modify the script.
trans-unit.target: Copy these into a separate place; you'll use them to modify the script.

trans-unit.source: Application Client ID
trans-unit.target: Application Client ID

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Applications tab.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Applications tab.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your newly created application.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your newly created application.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Configure tab.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Configure tab.

trans-unit.source: Your application's client ID is listed on the Client ID field.
trans-unit.target: Your application's client ID is listed on the Client ID field.

trans-unit.source: Application client secret
trans-unit.target: Application client secret

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Applications tab.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Applications tab.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your newly created application.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your newly created application.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Configure tab.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Configure tab.

trans-unit.source: Generate a new secret key for your application by selecting a duration in the "Keys" section.
trans-unit.target: Generate a new secret key for your application by selecting a duration in the "Keys" section.

trans-unit.source: The key will be displayed upon saving.
trans-unit.target: The key will be displayed upon saving.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to copy it and paste it into a safe location, because there is no way to retrieve it later.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to copy it and paste it into a safe location, because there is no way to retrieve it later.

trans-unit.source: Modify the script
trans-unit.target: Modify the script

trans-unit.source: Edit one of the scripts below to work with your directory by replacing $ClientID, $ClientSecret and $tenantdomain with the correct values from “Delegating Access in Azure AD”.
trans-unit.target: Edit one of the scripts below to work with your directory by replacing $ClientID, $ClientSecret and $tenantdomain with the correct values from “Delegating Access in Azure AD”.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell Script
trans-unit.target: PowerShell Script

trans-unit.source: Bash Script
trans-unit.target: Bash Script

trans-unit.source: Execute the script
trans-unit.target: Execute the script

trans-unit.source: Once you finish editing the script, run it and verify that the expected data from the AuditEvents report is returned.
trans-unit.target: Once you finish editing the script, run it and verify that the expected data from the AuditEvents report is returned.

trans-unit.source: The script returns lists all the available reports, and returns output from the AccountProvisioningEvents report in the PowerShell window in JSON format.
trans-unit.target: The script returns lists all the available reports, and returns output from the AccountProvisioningEvents report in the PowerShell window in JSON format.

trans-unit.source: It also creates files with the same output in JSON, text and XML.
trans-unit.target: It also creates files with the same output in JSON, text and XML.

trans-unit.source: You can comment experiment with modifying the script to return data from other reports, and comment out the output formats that you do not need.
trans-unit.target: You can comment experiment with modifying the script to return data from other reports, and comment out the output formats that you do not need.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.target: Curious about what security, audit, and activity reports are available?

trans-unit.source: Check out <link><linkText>Azure AD Security, Audit, and Activity Reports</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: Check out <link><linkText>Azure AD Security, Audit, and Activity Reports</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Azure AD Audit Report Events</linkText><title></title></link> for more details on the Audit Report
